sense.name: Literally cause to become unable to see.
sense.examples: The government blinded criminals with battery acid and set them to the streets. He blinded himself with pins. The sun blinded him as a child.

sense.name: Make unable to perceive something; be unable to view a situation or entity objectively.
sense.examples: Politicians are increasinly blinded by private interests. Rage blinded her to the needs of her family. Ego blinds us to universal truths.
